(1974, University of Windsor, Canada) B.Sc. (1972, University of British Columbia, Canada) Research Interests: Modeling for Decision Support Systems, Reasoning with Uncertainty, Subjective Logic, Conceptual Spaces, Conceptual Reasoning Health Informatics, Application Development in Healthcare, Self-management Systems in Healthcare Grid computing, High-Performance Computing and Networking Security, Network Forensics Theoretical spectroscopy, Unitary Group Approach, Scientific Computing Professional & Community Affiliations: Member, The Sandbox Project – Brain Injury Prevention Group Reviewer, Physical Review A Reviewer, Physical Review D Reviewer, Physical Review Letters Reviewer, Journal of Physics A Reviewer, The Canadian Journal of Physics Reviewer, Journal of the Electrochemical Society Reviewer, Journal of Computational Physics Selected Publications: Janaswamy, Sreya; Kent, Robert D., Semantic Interoperability and Data Mapping in EHR Systems, 2016 IEEE 6th International Conference on Advanced Computing (IACC), 117-122, 2016, IEEE Conference Publishing Services (CPS), 6th IEEE International Advance Computing Conference (IACC - 2016), 27-28 February 2016, S R K R Engineering College, Bhimavaram, Andhra Pradesh, India. Baert, Todd; McKay, Phillip; Carriveau, Rupp; Ting, David; Kent, Robert D., Windtelligence: the development of a wind farm performance management system, North American Wind Energy Academy 2015 Symposium (NAWEA 2015), North American Wind Energy Academy, U.S. Dep't of Energy, 2015, June, Blacksburg, Virginia, June 9-11, 2015. Snowdon, Anne; Hussein, Abdulkadir; Kent, Robert; Pino, Lou; Hachinski, Vladimir, Comparison of an Electronic and Paper-Based Montreal Cognitive Assessment Tool, Alzheimer Dis Assoc Disord., 29(4), 325-9, 2015, October. Subhani, Numanul; Kent, Robert D., Novel design approach to build audit rule ontology for healthcare decision support systems, 133-138, 2014, July, The 2014 International Conference on e-Learning, e-Business, Enterprise Information Systems, and e-Government (EEE '14).
